triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the primary platform used in this paper for performing mobile edge computing tasks.

triples.name: Mobile edge computing
triples.relevance: MEC is the computing framework that the paper optimizes with UAVs providing the computational resources.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Deep RL is the core machine learning methodology employed to solve the trajectory planning problem.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems framework is essential for managing independent UAV trajectories in the system.

triples.name: Policy gradient method
triples.relevance: Policy gradient methods are the algorithmic foundation for MADDPG used to optimize UAV policies.

triples.name: Actor-critic algorithm
triples.relevance: Actor-critic is the architecture pattern underlying MADDPG for learning both policy and value functions.

triples.name: Multi-agent reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: MARL is the specific reinforcement learning paradigm used for coordinating multiple UAVs independently.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning principles underpin the trajectory planning task for UAVs in the paper.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: Mathematical optimization is the theoretical framework for jointly optimizing fairness and energy consumption objectives.

triples.name: Multi-Agent Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient
triples.relevance: MADDPG is the specific algorithm proposed and applied in this paper for trajectory control.
